intro: Anisotes rogersii, commonly known as the ghost orchid, is a rare and enigmatic flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a terrestrial orchid that grows in shaded, moist environments, typically in the understory of forests. The plant has a unique morphology, featuring a single, fleshy stem and a single, showy flower with a distinctive hood-like structure. Its leaves are broad and strap-like, often covered in a dense layer of fine, white hairs. Anisotes rogersii is known for its elusive nature and is considered one of the most difficult orchids to cultivate outside its natural habitat.
